intro: Pleurolobus heterocarpon, commonly known as the purple false indigo, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive purple flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas.
